bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Mary E. Teller. John Duggan Testimony
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.
Multiple case files included with habeas petition

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Spokane County Government; Clerk, Territorial Case Files, 1879-1889

div1.p:
John Duggan sworn and testified Know defendant she is my sister knew Frank Teller in life knew him 6 years is my sisters husband - I know he is not alive - I know when he died - he died on Tuesday 31st of May, I know how he came to his death - his name is Franklin we all call him Frank - he was shot by his wife the defendant here - with a 38 inch shooter - shown pistol and witness identifies it - Pistol introduced in evidence - between 6 and 7 AM - both got up before I did - they had been up quite a while before I got up. I got up then - and said I would go and get the horses and go to work - Teller says never mind the horses let the horses alone he would tend to them - Mary says Never mind him go ahead and get the horses I said no he forbid me taking the horses - she said then she would go and get the horses - she went and got the horses and brung them as far as the gate - Teller came out with the shot gun cocked it in her face - brought horse to front gate Gate about 4 feet wide about oposite the front door - open I think - he was right in front the gate and she about in the gate when he drew in the gun on her - Horses head in halter she was leading the horses she knocked the gun out of her face with the left hand
has both halter straps in right hand - pulled pistol with right hand - did not see where she pulled pistol from there she changed hands with halters - they were length of shot gun when she shot first - when she shot first he fell back on his left arm - he got up then came towards her swearing he would kill her - had gun in his hand where he got up with hammers up - when he fell he sort of staggered sideways and fell on his left arm - when he got up second time they about - I cannot say how far apart. Shown diagram no building that I was standing south of the house about halfway between house and granary say 15 steps when he got up second time she shot him again - he fell forward then on his face - the second time she shot him she was standing close to the gate - she had turned one horse loose when she shot the second time she was holding one horse - Shown board dont know that I have seen this have seen slats like I saw something in her hands like it at that time - after she shot 2 times he fell forward and never got up- defendant after shooting him 2nd time said she would go to Spokane - picked slat
after first shot seemed like it was laying right there some where - she hit him on the head with two or three times Cant say which hand she picked it up with - held on to the horse and with both hands - struck him about the head somewhere - he had the shot gun then when she struck him on the head he fell backward not at full length - when he got up second time when she knocked him down with stick he did not have gun in his hands - she shot him again after this - he did not have gun in his hands then - she then said she would go to Spokane I dont know whether she struck him after the second shot -between 1st and last shot short time - I was about half between house I went a few steps but when he came with gun I stopped - she left then - I caught my horse and went to a neighbors I did not come up to where Teller lay did not returned there until the next morning
X

I am 21 years old I think I dont know how old my sister my sister is older has been married to Teller as near as I know 4 years while they lived together they lived there at that place - I had been living in that place about two months when Teller was killed - there was an agreement between myself and Teller
by which I was to work the place up there arrangement included the work and use of the horses spoken of - I was to live then with my sister and she to keep me - the working of the place - between 35 and 40 acres under cultivation - Teller had been at home prior to killing there day before (Monday) saw Mr Teller on Monday evening at home no one else there - Mrs Teller came there with me - he was setting in the house - about between sun down and dark - Mrs Teller returned about not long after she went there - House and kitchen joined are only rooms - I slept in the N.E. Corner of the house bed on the bed on the floor Mr Teller slept in the south west corner bed mound a little from the side - he slept with Mary his wife - dont know which one got up first I was asleep - my bed about three feet from door heading to kitchen before I got up. I heard no conversation between Teller and wife - they had been quaralling during the night - It was about the horses he wanted to know what she came to Spokane for what business she had at Spokane and what business she had to come there that night - next morning did not hear any conversation before going to get the horses - she was in the kitchen when I spoke of getting the horses told her I would get the horses
5
didnt you say to her this Mary while your getting breakfast Ill go and get horse to do that rolling - I said Ill go and get the horses. I might have said it but I dont remember it - Mr Teller was in the house when I made the remark - and was not doing anything - standing up Teller said let the horses alone he would tend to horses - he should have known for what purpose I was to get the horses - I think I have mentioned to him that night I was going to roll - was going to get them to roll the ground he spoke right out in a partly rough way rougher than he usually spoke. Teller done nothing then since he gave me in charge of the place 7 horses - dont hardly know why I did not go and get them not ever having any trouble with Teller preferred not to when Teller forbid me getting the horse - I done nothing then before Teller said she would go and get them - Teller said nothing - she did then start to get the horses dont know how long she was after them not long - dont think 10 or 15 minutes. Horses were out East of the house say 350 or 400 yards. I think she could go in that time I dont know what Teller was doing - I went out to the old house left Teller in main house - that to the old house fix a line on the harness - did not go for horses because I feared difficulty with Mr Teller. There has been a gun kept there prior to the killing all the time - I would know the gun shown gun identifies it as the one in the evidence
usually kept in the door in the main went into the kitchen - did not notice gun Monday night when I got home - I saw it Tuesday morning setting in the corner of the house - dont know whether loaded or not - If Teller went out without the gun and turned the horses loose without the gun I do not know it - I do not know it the second time he went out to turn the horses loose that I have spoken of - It could have happened that he went out without my knowledge - I heard Mr Teller make threats to Ms Teller when he went with the gun "if you dont have those horses loose Ill shoot you" I did not hear him threat to kill her if she did not leave the place that morning. I did at I was the friday before that in the house - " If you dont leave here Ill shoot you or burn you out" I did not hear Teller say to my sister in the morning that if she did not take the clothes and go away I will burn you out or kill you some night" I did say to my sister that Mary that I was afraid Teller would do her some harm and for her to be on her guard told her this because he had made so many threats I thought he might - I told her this from Teller threats & manner that morning - when I first saw Teller with gun he was coming out of the house - Mrs Teller was coming up to the gate - held gun one hand with barrell one butt just ready to fetch it to her face

Witness illustrates - walked toward her carrying gun in same position - gun cocked when he came out I did not see him cock it - I know who took the gun down - Frank Teller took it down that morning - first words I heard him are when he had the gun in his hands was "saw you turn those horses loose and leave here or I will kill you" he was about 6 or 8 feet from her when he used those words - he continued to advance upon her when he said that - she made no reply that I heard after saying that he walked right up and pointed the muzzle in her face - she then knocked the gun on side and pulled the pistol and shot one shot at that time - Hand with real position she did not fire but think only one - he fell backwards and partly down and she turned one horse loose - he then straighted himself up and attempted to point his gun at her again - said then turn the horses loose or he would kill her - she then picked up slat or club and hit him on the head with it two or three times -

In answer to a question Is it not a fact that she shot again instead of striking witness answer I dont know that I seen that In answer to the question "is it not a fact that she did not strike him until she had fired all the shots that the pistol did fire - dont know that I saw that either

After she struck him he hardly got to his feet again when she fired last time he was coming toward her she did shoot at him after striking him with the board - she hit him two or three blows as near as
I can tell - all shown after she fired the shots she did not that I saw hit him after firing the last shot - he was on his feet when she fired last shot - when she fired last shot fell over on his face toward her Shown diagram - she was was standing about in the gate he the length of the yard from her - she did not stand there when she struck him
Isnt it a fact that after she fired the first shot from the gate that he staggered back toward the middle of the yard and that when he attemted for the revolver that she advanced upon him

ans - he advanced a little - I saw where he fell after the killing the diagram represents similar place to where he fell - I think three shots in the pistol - I know where Mrs Teller got the pistol - after Teller taking the shot gun down and loading it I went to her and told her I feared he was going to do her some harm and gave her the pistol and told her to protect herself - that was in the morning just after she had started for the horses - they for was from him taking down the gun loading it and setting it in the corner - and from the further threats he had made for her - when she said she would go and get the horses he said nothing - I did not see Mrs Teller hit him with anything but that peice of board - she could not have hit him with anything else without my seeing it

ReDirect I had rented farm of Teller
9
some time in month of March - rented house with farm - had no just words between us implements and horses same time rented the horses of Teller - she was cooking for me on the place - I was not paying her she was staying there in her garden with me - I was in the house when she went for the horses - she went out front door - I to end of old house south - she front of old house south of shed little further back from fence than the horses - did not stay there long - went with the intention of fixing line when I came out of old house went into the house Teller in kitchen I went in for an awl got awl saw the gun loaded setting in the corner then I was where Mary was she had Halter for the horse she was done - foot of the horse - she had not the house I did not help her catch them - when I saw her then later I was afraid Teller would do her some harm and gave her the pistol I dont know what she done with the pistol - she for horse and I went back to fix my line to old house - remained there not a good while when I came out she coming up to gate with horses about 10 or 15 steps from gate - 30 paces from old to new houses - Teller in new house - I was halfway between houses when he came out - when I first saw him with gun he was half
way to gate I know he came out of the house - when I noticed him with gun he was he was halfway to gate - I dont mean to be understood that when I first saw him with gun he was came out of house - left hand on barrell holding in front and to right of him - right side toward & portion of face toward me - facing south east coming gate had one horse by halter when she shot held back when she struck him with stick - she she struck him with stick did not get quite up but mighty near it made motion to go forwad before he got up she shot and he fell on his face dont know whether his feet in same place as when she struck him - did not have the gun when he tried to get up - I dont know as whether his feet moved or not after seemed shot he did not get up when he fell last time cant state how far his hand for gate dont think defendant brought horse inside - halter straps 8 or 10 feet long - I had advanced two or three steps when he fell last time I went and crawled under the fence and caught a horse and left - last time he went out of farm door was with awl near see my blows there but that seeing my nose was bleeding and I was sitting on the front steps on step in front of door - I was sitting on that step on step beside door sill - nose bled 3 or 4 minutes that evening - dripped sat still while nose bleeding might have moved one side to let out

When I went of the door with awl I dont know
as that there was any splinters or chips with blood on or not I knew where the ax was in the morning of the killing - it was at the wood pile at end of old house shed - the ax was between me and the old house when I saw Teller go out with gun - I dont know where board by was laying when she picked it up - think it has been used for a bed slat - bed sister and Teller occupied had slats - dont know the size - when I started out to give pistol to sister bed was not made up dont know whether a slat was gone or not - never been inside the house since until he died did not notice condition of bed that morning

Re X Court measures bed slat 31 41 inches long - I was to have share of & Teller share of and Mrs T to remain there and keep horses - I know his wife has a mortgage on the houses I was working there - I did not tell her when I gave her pistol Teller had taken gun down and loaded it - Am subject to nose bleed - my nose commenced bleeding Monday evening after I got home I bled 3 or 4 minutes went to front steps and sat down when bleeding dont think I moved round any this is the ax that is kept on the place - I know what the marks are it is pitch of wagon is wagon grease shown old mark think from pine or burch bark looks like blood dont reccolect of having it when having nose bleed think board - front of a then dont think I had then - shown mark near the - dont know
that it is under paint for of there is a mortgage in all his houses to Mary Teller for the sum of 400.00 think it was given this spring or winter nothing paid as I know of -- think going for a year
explanation by witness = after she shot him first time she turned one horse loose

By Prosecution (in response to question)
This all happened in Spokane County Washington Territory had nose bleed between sun down and dark Monday evening - did not notice it when i went out to give Mary revolver I cant say exactly how far blood would be from steps when I had nose bleed - could not have been too far - dont know whether I testified before coroner jury where my sister got pistol or not

By Defendant attorney
I was excited but not scared - on the morning of the inquest and I was excited
John Duggan
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 9th day of June 1887
Jno J Booge
Justice of the Peace
Territory of Washington vs Mary Teller
Testimony of John Duggan
Filed June 9th 1887
